Eats! is as small as it looks from the street, which is why it always seems more comfortable when children are not in the building. Just compare dining here to being on an airplane and how much nicer your flight is when it is only a group of adults in the cabin.   

Their freshly made potato chips and dipping sauce go so well with a cold beer that I'm ashamed it was not even mentioned in my previous review.

By now, I hope everyone knows that the burgers here remain some of the best in the Tampa Bay Area and the Midwest BLT is really a unique and flavorful sandwich.

Just watch out for the old drunk wearing the outdated Devil Rays hat at the bar who Danny affectionately calls, "Larry Rothschild." This guy quietly drinks his beer and then out of nowhere, will start pointing at a TV making unsolicited and enebriated commentary. 

Trust me, everyone at the bar finds this much more entertaining than trying to shoehorn live music into a corner of the dining room.

Bought a groupon and figured I would check out the place.  Bought the ground beef and smoked applewood bacon burger.  Tasted good but wasn't something I would have to come back for. They get 4 stars because the freshly made potato chips and the cool cheers like atmosphere

Ok fellow yelpers I have no idea why this place has such high ratings! The food was terrible, the atmosphere , blah and the service, indifferent.

Came in on the last day of a Groupon deal Weds 4pm. Didnt get greeted by anyone , saw about 6 people at the bar, so we sat at a high top at the bar area.

We had two servers this visit, #1 we'll call Moppy cause of the hair, #2 we'll call sneezy cause he was sick. (I love sick people coming to work in a hospitality industry, servig food and rinks to people while sick-grrrr)

So Moppy comes over asks what we'd like to drink, hubby says "mmm well not sure what you have" while trying to see the taps at the bar or a drink menu. Moppy never says anything so we opt for two pumpkin beers we saw on the sign coming in. They were served in warm root beer mugs  @ $6.00 each.

Then we got the complimentary chips and dressing. Have no idea why people rave about these. Ordinary "homemade" chips you get anywhere with a watered down sauce that tasted like a combination of Thousand Island and ranch. Not impressive.

I was eyeing the beer cheese soup($3.29) but hubby wanted that so I got a cup of chili ($3.29) so we could taste a bit of each. The Texas chili (which BTW no self respecting Texan would ever put beans in a chili)  was soo hot , as in spicey hot, that I knew my stomach would kick my butt later so I couldn't eat and traded with hubby. I like hot food, but I know this must get sent back over and over cause Floridians don't do heat. The beer cheese soup didn't fare any better, it was watery and bland. The shredded cheese on top had more flavor than this gruel.

So Sneezy is done flirting with some excoworker that was sitting at the bar and he takes over serving us so Moppy can pick up where he left off with the girl.We opt to switch to another beer as the pumpkins are too heavy and we're finally told what they have and (Here's comes the BEST thing about this place) I find out they have Stella 2-4-1. Amazing, you don't get Stella 2-4-1 anywhere in this town! 

After another round we opt for food. French dip ($8.99)for me, with added sauteed mushrooms ($1.00) and a fried pork chop sandwich($8.99) for Daddy'o.
Oh the disappointment. The french dip came sans mushrooms which took me a minute to discover as I thought the little black burnt things might have been a remnant of said funghi but no, it was just burnt food. Hubby breaded pork chp was breaded so poorly the breading was pulling away from the chop before he even bit into it. It was dry and the spicy sauce (not spicy) couldn't even assist this fiasco. Both sandwiches were served with "house seasoned fries" That has to be a joke. These are straight out of the bag Ore Ida crinkle fries sprinkled with something red with no taste.

All in all, we found the service to be lackadaisical, the food to be horrendous and the atmosphere bland and boring. I would only return for 2-4-1 Stellas and I don't think they could get me happy enough to enjoy the food here, it was THAT bad.

Solid meal at EATS.  I visited on a weeknight looking for a hearty dinner and was pleasantly surprised. The setting is kinda a mix of half sports&beer bar, half family restaurant or diner. My waitress (Lindsay) was super helpful and attentive.

I opted for the Rib and Chicken combo entrée with a side of baked sweet potato and a side of broccoli. The house salad that came out first was fresh and good size. No need for the shredded cheese and croutons but whatever. The ribs were tasty but ate more like a pork roast. I certainly could never pick these up. I just pulled out the bones and ate the meat with the veggies.  Both the ribs and chicken were covered in a good bit of rays BBQ sauce and certainly tasted like something mom made at home. The broccoli was simple but good, and a nice size portion. The sweet potato (sans sugar&butter) was great. 
Overall the meal was quite satisfying.  The flavors were kinda simple and what  you'd expect from a family restaurant/diner joint.  But hey, no complaints.

EATS! American Grill is situated on S. Dale Mabry, below Euclid, and just north of the Selmon Expressway. This popular, neighborhood eatery has been open since 2010, and was featured a few years ago on The Food Network.

Parking is limited out in front of the restaurant, but there is a larger lot behind. You can enter from the back of the building by walking up the ramp past all of the outdoor patio diners, and go straight into the pub. Inside you'll find a traditional sports bar look with TVs on the walls and a large bar in the back corner.

I would describe the menu as American Classic since they have bar appetizers, burgers, wraps, sammies, and salads. But, unlike a sports bar, they also have pasta bowls, chicken & waffles, grilled pork chops, steaks, seafood, and a whole lot more. This is a perfect place to come, and find something for everyone on their menu.

Our server was terrific, and she brought over the complimentary house-made kettle chips with the horseradish dipping sauce while taking our drink orders. I opted for Buffalo's claim to fame, the classic Beef on Weck sandwich, which is made with thinly-sliced roast beef sitting atop a kummleweck roll and topped with their Horsey sauce, and served with some au just for dipping.

My lovely dining companion ordered the San Francisco burger which was a half pound Angus beef burger, sitting on grilled sourdough bread, and topped with garlic aioli, pepper jack, avocado, peppered bacon, lettuce, tomato, and onion. She added a side of jalapeno Mac-n-cheese in lieu of the fries, and took most of that home, along with half of her burger.

EATS! is a very comfortable place to enjoy a nice meal, and then keep coming back to try different items on their menu. Happy Happy Happy!

Attended an UYE today and was impressed. 

This place is located in an obscure building near beefs on s. Dale Mabry.

Parking is tight but there was room in the back lot. 

They have good drafts...magic hat #9, shock top, Stella and BL.

They showered us with sliders which were tasty, wings (try the garlic Parmesan) and buffalo chips. 

They do offer NFL tix and I could see myself hanging out watching a game here and drinking some brewskis.

Nice local dive/restaurant. Looks to have a steady bar crowd & an adjoining area for others to sit & grab a meal. Nothing fancy, just good food. Wait staff was friendly during my visit & decently prompt. I had the Fried Pork Chop sandwich and Mac & Cheese. Both were great. Good choice if you're trying to get away from chain restaurants & kickback casually.

Seems like I update my review on Eats once a year and nothing changes.

Tonight, it was as busy as I've ever seen it and I barely had any time to catch up with the great bartender Danny about our favorite things (golf, Big Brother and all our common friends from those vintage Stadium Bennigan's days).

Seemed like everytime I looked up there was a new party of two, party of four or party of eight hanging around the bar waiting for the next table to open up.

This place is no secret. The drink specials are very good and the menu is delicious.

No, the room isn't very big and there isn't a lot of room to move around in there, but what Eats offers from a staff that really hustles is obviously worth it.

Not a good experience. First of all, the place was extremely loud. I'm not sure if it's always like this or just because I went on a Monday evening when the Bucs would be playing later and they had a $5 burger special. It was a packed house.  It was headache-inducing. Aside from that, the burger took 25 minutes but it was good, not great (seemed like it was a frozen patty), my glass was empty for about 20 minutes and the waiter never gave me the mayo for my burger (after he asked me if I wanted it). I finally got a refill from the bartender when I was just about finished with my burger.  The server was too busy doing random things like changing TV stations and vacuuming the floor rather than putting ready orders on the tables and checking up on customers. When I got my check from the bartender, she ran off before I could tell her I needed a pen to sign it so I had to look for one. I couldn't wait to get out of there. To recap: average food, bad service, a loud (at least on Monday night) and rundown restaurant.

We've been to Eats! a handful of times over the years. It is one of our main go-to spots when we are in South Tampa. The food is consistently good and decently priced. They also serve some house made chips when you sit down which is cool. 

On this previous trip we split an order of hot buffalo wings to start. Their hot buffalo sauce actually has some heat to it. A lot of local places have very mild hot sauce. It was perfect for me, but it can be too much for some people with more sensitive palates. 

For an entree, I had a lot of choices. I am on a low carb diet, so I was surprised by this. They have a lot of amazing salads with just about any protein you would like added to it. I was tempted by a salad with salmon added to it, but I changed my mind. 

Since it was Sunday and I was eating wings and watching football, I went with the Vincent Jackson burger (V-Jack I think it is called) without the bun. They donate $1 to charity if you order it. 

The burger is huge and decadent. Two 4oz patties with pulled pork in between them. It was served with onion rings on top (I pulled those off) and BBQ sauce on the side. I added hot buffalo sauce instead. It was amazing. Perfectly cooked. For my side, I ordered a side salad. It was huge too and it had a decent amount of chopped toppings. 

Basically, I did not eat everything and left super full and happy. Our meal was delicious and I will definitely keep coming back here.

2 reasons for my visit: They had a Groupon offer and I heard this place was on Food Network's "Heat Seekers". Considering my affinity for spicy food, this seemed to be a no-brainer... and let me tell you, I was not disappointed. The server brought a basket of house-made potato chips while my friend and I were deciding what to order. The chips were simple, but unbelievably awesome -- not too thin, not too thick, perfectly fried and seasoned served with a homemade ranch sauce. If that was any indication of what's to come, I was excited.

We started out with a bowl of Texas Chili and it was some of the best chili I've had in a LOOOOONG time -- an explosion of flavor with punch of great spicy heat and big chunks of ground beef. My friend order the Midwest BLT with a baked Sweet Potato and I got the Fried Pork Sandwich with Mac 'n Cheese. Both sandwiches come with the signature spicy sauce on it, but you can request the really hot 7-pepper sauce that Food Network came for... so I got that on the side. The BLT was loaded with delicious bacon (redundant? :-P) and the baked sweet potato was nicely baked and topped in the traditional manner with cinnamon and a bit of butter. The Fried Pork Sandwich was juicy and perfectly seasoned. The spicy sauce gave it a great zing. I put a little bit of the 7-pepper sauce on my sandwich and it definitely added a great deal of spiciness to it, but surprisingly, it also added a whole new dimension to the flavor profile. Many really spicy sauces just add heat without adding flavor, but this sauce does both extremely successfully.

I thoroughly enjoyed the entire experience from start to finish. The service and food were exceptional. I would come back just for the chili... that I'm probably going to have dreams about.

When we walked in we just kind of stood there thinking that we needed to be seated. After staring at us for 3 minutes, we asked about seating and they let us know it was self seating. Maybe it was confusing because we came from the back entrance. 

I was pretty disappointed with the food here.  I tried the black and blue burger as well as chicken and waffles. Everything with the exception of the waffles and burger needed more seasoning. The burger was the best item but it came with the bottom bun completely soaked in sauce and falling apart. I thought the chips and dips were good and was a nice touch. Maybe I ordered the wrong things but I don't think I'll be back.

Good wings.  Wednesday is wing day 70cents per wing. Not a bad deal. 

The shrimp and corn chowder was good. Got that to go. The portion size was rather small for a bowl. Got the fish tacos to go as well. Didn't care for them or the macaroni and cheese.

I have passed by this place every day for the last year plus and have been intending to stop in, but hadn't...until last Tuesday. I was curious about the inside because from the outside it looked tiny. There was ample parking out back, a patio with seating, and then the inside which was roomier than I was expecting. Everywhere was clean and in order, with several TVs showing sports. It was just after lunchtime so there were only a couple other people there, which I think was best for me and my youngest (but she was quiet). I got the garlic mashed potatoes for her, and the bites I stole as I fed her were delicious. For myself I ordered the lobster bisque, San Francisco burger, and the seasoned fries. The burger was big, juicy, and very good, especially the sourdough that tasted like garlic toast. The avocado, bacon, and other stuff inside was plentiful and all worked well together. I really enjoyed their fries and the mango iced tea that washed it all down too. I did not like the soup however. My bill pre tip was right around $20. The staff was very friendly, attentive, and helpful, as I had my 11 month old and all the accessories that come with her. They have a fairly decent selection of foods, and I believe I will be back to try again.

Eats! American Grill has a friendly neighborhood bar vibe.  Great black and white early American photos cover the walls as well as big screen tv's broadcasting sporting events.  The menu is American Classic dishes... perfect for the picky eater.  I usually go for an edgier menu, but really enjoyed the traditional dishes.

Our waitress was super; friendly and never left us waiting for refills or the check.  We went on a Monday and got the $5 burgers - great deal!  I got the Black and Blue Burger (blackened seasoning with blue cheese) and added bacon to the burger...yummy!  The seasoned fries that came with the burger were great, but I would have swapped them for a side salad had I known we would get complimentary homemade kettle chips.  

Will be back to try the Waldorf Salad!

I found this bar food to be pretty average as well as the atmosphere. It wasn't particularly clean and the service wasn't great either. We ordered the Mac n cheese bites which were average as well as the banging shrimp which were the best thing we ordered. Burger and fries where pretty average. I'd be scared to order anything fancier here. Beer was cold. Can't say I'd rush back anytime soon.

This is a fine family-feel pub I expect to visit again now that my daughter's family has moved nearby.   Full service bar with several drafts from local breweries, including Cigar City and 3 Daughters.   The food menu offers considerably more options than typical pub grub, in addition to the obligatory wings, burgers and sandwiches.   This is one of the few spots in the area that offer roast beef on a faux-kummelweck bun.  Since this is a Western New York specialty, there is no local source for the genuine buns, but they take good kaiser rolls and supplement with caraway seeds and rock salt.....not a bad sub.  Served authentically with au jus and horseradish sauce.  Now that Honey's on N Dale Mabry is gone, this is the best RB on K i have tried.  So I will be back for nostalgia purposes...and it would be even more memory-evoking if served in a walk-in freezer, carpeted with dirty slush......just like Buffalo.

The chips and sauce they offer you to nibble on is amazing!!! Yum yum yum! I can never get enough of them. I usually go here for the wings because they're BOSS!! There's many different sauces to choose from so you have no choice but to return so you can try them all. It's a small, older looking building with a rather small parking lot, but I've never had a problem finding a parking spot, even when they have been busy. The food always comes out in a timely manner, so your mouth won't be drooling too much waiting for those wings. Whether you're grabbing a beer or at a table, this is a casual spot to go to. Don't forget, they have a wing special on Wednesdays! I believe it's 70 cents/ wing. Enjoy!!

They have amazing wings here! They're pretty big in size and always delicious. I also love the chips they serve with a ranch sauce on the side. Those are the bomb! Once I stopped eating chicken though, I sadly, had no reason to return. I'm just not a huge fan of their salads. I recall thinking they were bland and "nothing special". I'd say Eats American Grill is a great place to go for a low- key dinner or place to watch sports. The waitresses are nice here as well! It's a small restaurant but I've never had to wait to sit and the parking lot is also small, but I've never had a problem finding a spot. enjoy! xo

Why 4 stars?  Because it was a solid experience.

   ---   ---   ---

I knew that the fried pork sandwich was the main event, but I was too tempted by the Philly Cheesesteak with the picture of Geno's in Philadelphia on the menu next to it.  Luckily, my friend got the fried pork sandwich, so I was able to try both.

Both items were really great.  The cheesesteak did not taste like Geno's, but it was really good.  I expected it to be closer to the original cheeseteak king because the menu mentioned that included cheese whiz, but it seemed to be much greasier than Geno's. 

The fried pork sandwich was really good and definitely unique.  It came with a spicy sauce, that apparently had an even spicier version as an option.  We were told by our server that the fried pork sandwich was going to be on some kind of food network show for spicy foods.  My friend got the more mild version though, and it was delicious.

I will definitely go back to EATS!

This will have to be my now 2nd or 3rd favorite place to eat in tampa.  The decor is a little drabby, but who really cares when the food is delicious!  Instead of the ordinary bread to start, they serve homemade chips with some delicious sauce to dip.  The I fried pickle chips are also pretty awesome.  And their buffalo wings were pretty close to home.  Our server was fast & friendly and the cost of our meal was pretty reasonable.  You definitely have to try.

Well, let's see, on a super broiling, steamy sunny at the moment  95 degree day where we  are restricted to places with outside seating because we have our precious dog with us, this place was awesome to the max.  We had our private outside area with two huge fans and super shade and great service. Our sweat was not pouring down on us like we thought it would.
We also had a super generous $50 gift card from the Yelptucky Derby event that helped us put the cherry on top of this place.  Everything from the service, to the food was amazing.  Our home made chips that were provided to us hit the spot with the yummy sauce that accompanied it.. One of our favorite sides ever that we had not found at any other restaurant was the pineapple fritters. Breaded pineapple with a tropical sauce. Oh yeah.
Our meals consisted of steak and salmon with walnuts, and a steak for my husband. My sirloin was tender and less fattening than his.  They were scrumptious. At first the salmon seemed a bit pink for me. They made me a brand new one and it was WONDERFUL.
Our Dessert, you would just die. It was a gigantic Fried Oreo Cookie Sundae. No words can speak of this wonderful joy. It was beyond music to your ears, and waves on a beautiful beach, and everything and all that, etc. etc...Really, we had a smile on our face. All was great. We really would probably have not stopped here if we did not have the gift certificate just because it is not an area that we frequent. 
It is awesome though. We will definitely be back. You better go, you will be so happy that you did.

When the desire for coffee hits, which is pretty much after I finish the previous cup its good to know that there's always a dunkin near by even when driving down the Highway. We stopped in to grab a couple donuts and of course a cup of coffee or two and some how we left with some ice cream as well at 10am. They were pretty busy not only through the drive thru but also inside yet the wait was minimal and the taste of everything was on par. Oh did I mention they have a putting green just outside and golf clubs to borrow for a chance at a hole in one! So stop in for a bite.

Was looking for some Italian takeout Saturday night and had seen this place months prior when dining outdoors at Mari BYO, now closed (sad face emoji). 

They've got literally everything, which can be a tad overwhelming: wood-fired pizzas and wings, hoagies, strombolis and calzones, pasta, chicken, seafood, sides, apps, etc. 

BF got the wood-fired BBQ wings and the Mimosa Pizza (ham, corn, basil) and I got the Linguine Pescatore in white butter sauce, which comes with mussels, clams and shrimp, and a side Caesar salad.

Overall, everything was tasty (the mussels were my favorite!) but nothing stood out as fantastic, especially since the similar pescatore dish at Mari is still one of my favorite bang-for-your-buck meals in the city and is so light and delicate. The seafood was plentiful and fresh, but the broth was way salty.

The pizza had interesting toppings/flavor combinations, but was VERY thin/floppy (even for Napoli style) and also only 14" as the largest size, and at approx. $18 I'm not sure it was worth it. BF did say his wings were excellent. If portions were a bit larger perhaps I would order again, but there's a million other Italian joints to try.

Staff was very friendly, though.

I came here because I wanted to try their brick-oven. I made a reservation with google, it's so easy.

I asked for indoor seating and got seated near the balcony with a nice view of the street. Our seating is also next to the kitchen who had Latino music being played. I felt like I was in a Mexican restaurant instead of at an Italian restaurant. 

They served warm bread which used the same dough as the pizza. So delicious with the olive oil dipping.

Appetizer: bruschetta. The bread was nicely toasted with generous chunks of tomatoes drizzled with balsamic vinegar. Highly recommended.

I ordered salad with seafood. I was expecting a dinner size salad but it was served in a small bowl. It's quite expensive for $18.

Eggplant pizza: the crust is doughy in my opinion. Good stretch and chewiness but lack of some crispness of the crust.

Tiramisu is quite delicious, I enjoyed the lady fingers soaked with the espresso.

Located in the small shopping plaza with the Dollar General across the street from Schnucks grocery.  The restaurant is in a huge store front with lots of windows.  The main entrance is through the left set of doors.  While it make look dark from the outside, don't worry, it's just the tint on the windows.

Upon entering, there is no hostess stand so it's a little confusing.  The waitress saw me immediately and was able to assist.  Right when you walk in, there is a large open room filled with tables and booths with a busser stand on the back wall.  To the right of the main entrance is a second room with a bar, high top tables, and some TVs.  If you don't see a waitress, just walk to the bar since there was a bartender available.

I placed a to-go order and it was ready within 10 minutes from my call.  My order of Bun Thit Nuong (vermicelli noodles with grilled beef, 2 shrimp, 1 large egg roll, fresh veggies, peanuts, and fish sauce) was a large portion.  The meat was not tough, the shrimp were cooked perfectly, and the egg roll was only slightly soggy after the car ride back to the office.  I would absolutely order again, but I've got my eye on the pho next, or banh mi next.

Overall, food is good, service was good, décor inside and out is lacking.  I would rather have good food over good décor any day!

This is the actually the most funniest thing on the block. It just doesn't fit.  You got all these trendy stores up and down the street. Nice eateries and restaurants all over. Then you got gift shops, craft stores, jewelery stores, books stores, clothing stores... then you get this Adult store in big words no less.

This place carry the usual porn, not that I know what it's in, what's new, and what's good. Maybe the store does stick out like an eyesore, but it's just way too funny to see a store like this as part of the trendy downtown Santa Barbara.

I prefer CVS over other pharmacies as I can generally get in and out of their stores without a lot of hassle, or a long wait at the check-out lines.

This particular CVS is at the intersection of Gunn Highway and Anderson Road, in the same little shopping plaza as Bank of America. Even though they close at 10pm it is still a very convenient place to stop as I drive up and down Gunn on my way to Citrus Park. If I need a 24-hour drug store then I drive over to the CVS on N. Dale Mabry near my house.

The store is compact, but fully stocked of the necessities of life, and their prices are certainly reasonable. This is my go-to spot for last-minute toothpaste, mouthwash, bar soap, shaving cream, razor blades, etc. There are certainly cheaper places to visit if you need paper and plastic products, dishwashing soap, or a quart of milk, but it's tough to beat the convenience of CVS if you're in a hurry.

They do have a pharmacy in the back of the store that stays open till 10pm, and their pharmacists are super helpful and friendly. I generally get my flu shots at this store since it's quick and easy with no appointment needed.

The bathroom here is so disgusting. The store itself looks very old. I miss the days when I had a nice local CVS.

The cashiers are always very pleasant, and when I interacted with a pharmacist, she was nice as well.

This location is run-down, but I've sadly seen worse.

The nice thing is that the shelves are usually organized, with a few exceptions. One thing that irked me last time I visited was the fact that they don't have the Midol in the pain relief section. You have to go to the "feminine care" aisle with the pads and tampons, as if menstruation isn't painful and all the icky feminine things must be sequestered to one aisle.

At the end of the day, this CVS does what it's supposed to, but it's not a joy to patronize.

A good option if you're staying at one of the hotels located by the airport. Surprisingly good and trendy environment for a hotel restaurant. We split the Farm Fresh burger and the Lonestar. I personally liked the Lonestar better, but wish it had a bit more bbq sauce. The Farm Fresh was good with an obvious amount of goat cheese, but could have been better with a bit more red pepper. The fries were just okay, above your average fast food fries, but could have been a bit more seasoned. 
Overall, cute place with good but not great food.

As everyone else has already mentioned, this is a restaurant/bar within a hotel. 
The menu is small, but interesting, with  burger's being the house specialty. 
I tried the Lone Star burger (Cheddar cheese * thick-cut bacon * onion ring * BBQ sauce) with a side salad... the burger isn't the biggest I've ever had by far, but the flavor was very nice. The actual burger patty was on the dense and dry side, even so I ordered it medium. 
I also enjoyed the firecracker shrimp. Be advised, that you get only 6 shrimp, they are decent size, but... it's 6 shrimp for more than $10. The sauce is tasty, but a bit much. So this is very saucy and messy. You will need extra napkins.
In my humble opinion while the burgers are tasty, I would not travel out of my way for them. Cooped up in a hotel; however, they would be fabulous to have.

My wife and I stopped in for an early dinner on Tuesday evening at this hotel restaurant.  After a short walk through the lobby, the open sided bar/restaurant was easy to spot.  Since it was early, we had our pick of seats.  We selected a small table for two instead of a booth, bar seat, or large communal table.

After placing our order for a couple drafts (includes local craft brews), we placed our order for burgers and sides.  My wife went with the BT House burger and a side salad.  I opted for the Uptown Burger and cole slaw.  Both of us liked our choices.  Her burger came with American Cheese, grilled onions, lettuce, pickle, and a tasty house "KGB" sauce.  

My burger was seared nicely and had grilled portabello mushrooms, carmelized onions (kinda sweet), Swiss cheese, and roasted garlic mayo.  Very good!  Although the burger was 1/3 pound, it maintained its juiciness even with the searing.  The cole slaw was creamy and used red cabbage which created a pink color.  The taste was fine, but I can't say I have ever seen pink slaw before.  

Service was fine and we didn't have much of a wait between any of our dealings.  A bit on the pricey side, the flavors were comparable to high end burger places.  Thankfully, the fresh quality held up.

Review #155

Burger Theory is just okay in my book.  We were seated immediately and our drink orders were taken. I ordered the farm burger (I think that's what it was called). I was asked about the cook I wanted on both my meat (medium, please) as well as my egg (over-easy).  I also upgraded to onion rings instead of the standard fries. 

When my food arrived, my burger was well-done. The egg was cooked perfectly. I don't like to waste food, so I just ate it. Our server never really did ask how it was anyway.  The onion rings were breaded (I prefer battered) and definitely weren't anything special. That was another bummer. 

Our server was okay. She wasn't very personable, and she didn't seem to be enjoying her job. She kept our drinks full, but that was pretty much the extent of our interaction. 

Overall, I wouldn't recommend this place.  The food and service stunk.

Randomly really good for being in a hotel! If it wasn't located in a Holiday Inn, I would have assumed this was like any other Hipster burger joint that keeps popping up all over town. My farm burger was delicious with a great meat and cheese combo that melted in my mouth. I appreciated the full bar and beer/wine options. People ask me all the time about where to get food by the airport and now I have a new option to suggest to them!

First things first: Burger Theory is located within a hotel (the Holiday Inn Indianapolis Airport, to be exact). I'm just telling you to save you some trouble finding the place, and so you won't be driving around like a moron like I was. 

If I was staying at the Holiday Inn, I would be super psyched that there was a legitimate restaurant located on the first floor of my hotel. But as a regular customer, it's kind of confusing to visit a restaurant in a Holiday Inn. That being said, Burger Theory is just fine and dandy. Now, please take my review with a grain of salt, as we only got an appetizer, a dessert and a beer. Are the burgers great? I have no idea, but if you asked me about the nacho fries, I'd tell you that they come with a crapton of sauce. There was like 3/4 of a cup of sour cream plopped on the fries, and 1/2 cup of guacamole and salsa each. The presentation was not appealing. If you like lots of sauce, though, the nacho fries at Burger Theory will probably be your jam.

I got the brownie sundae, and that was fine. I ate it while drinking a pint, so that was pleasant.

The dining room at Burger Theory is exceedingly clean and organized. The service was friendly and always attentive. Apparently, if you stay at the Holiday Inn where Burger Theory is housed, you can have food delivered to your room. That's pretty awesome.

First time here. It was really nice inside. You could see the manager helping out and walking around making sure everyone was taken care of. I ordered the farmhouse burger. It had sautéed red peppers and onions, portobello mushrooms which I left off only because I don't care for mushrooms, garlic mayo and Boursin cheese. Not to mention the hamburger bun was a potato bun which I thought was much better than an ordinary bun. The onion rings were good as well. They have an option where you can make your own burger. The desserts looks so good! I was full so I didn't order one. Next time!

Burger joint located inside of a holiday inn express hotel near the Indianapolis airport. I enjoyed our cost here as the burgers were very tasty and the fries had good flavor. 

The place was clean and the service was good. The kids are for free so that's also a huge plus. It was the best food establishment I ate at located near our hotel by the airport. Much more  then just a hotel restaurant. Worth checking out for sure.

I do like a good burger  Burger Theory serves a GREAT burger.

We've been there several times, and I've tried a number of their burgers and I've never been disappointed.  Always cooked the way I order them.

Sides are plentiful.  I like their fries, but I'm a REAL fan of their onion rings.

Each time I've been here, the restaurant as been absolutely sparkling clean.  Sure, I don't give a white glove test, but it appears to be one of hte cleanest restaurants I've ever been in.

Make no mistake, they're premium burgers, so it's a bit more pricey than one might expect for a burger restaurant, but, in my mind, it's worth it.

I'm afraid I have to drop from a 5 to a 4 because of service.  It's never been awful, but it's been spotty from time to time so I can't justify a 5 star rating.

Having a great time at Picasso and Wine! My girlfriend and I painted a picture, shared some laughs, and fell a little more in love! I am no Picasso, however, after my night with Danielle painting a picture I feel like our art is worth a million dollars. 
I highly recommend dropping into one of the couple classes like the one Danielle and I participated in. If you are looking for a fun date night with your significant other, I HIGHLY recommend this place!

$35 for three hours of solid entertainment and the chance to learn and take home a masterpiece, sign me up! I regularly monitor the Picasso and Wine calendars. (Tip: each location features different classes). I was so excited to finally try my first Picasso and Wine and now I'm hooked!!

For a totally reasonable price, you get a full painting lesson and all supplies are included. I was surprised by how easy the class actually was because I am by no means an artist. 

I definitely recommend trying a Picasso and Wine class with your co-workers, your friends, or for date night!

Oh how fun was this?!  I am not artistic by any means or stretch of the imagination.  I can hardly draw stick figures, but trust me when I say, I actually painted something.  Sure, it's not perfect, and my masterpiece will not be hanging in any art gallery any time soon, but I am so proud of it, and I had tons of fun painting it.  I think I actually love it. 
I received a gift certificate to Picasso and Wine quite a long time ago, but didn't get a chance to use it until recently.  That's because I couldn't find the right time nor the right picture to try my painting skills on.  Finally, I had a chance to go with a couple other girlfriends, and we had a blast.  One of these girlfriends has a thing for snowmen, so that's the painting we picked.
We went to their space at the Summit Mall.  As soon as we got inside, we were greeted by Beth, who turned out to be our instructor for the night.  The room was cozy but there are enough 'stations' for 35 participants, I believe.  There's a full bar, much to our delight.  The room is beautifully decorated with different paintings that are offered in other classes.  
We got our drinks and took up our spots and the class promptly began.  Beth is such an encouraging and patient instructor.  The class was a mix of newbies and veterans, but everyone was in a great mood.  We just followed along as best we can.  There was no pressure.  You can go at your own pace, you can pick the colors you want, and you can really play with your artistic side.  The idea is to at least try it.  There is no right or wrong.  Nothing is beautiful or ugly.  It's all about self-expression.  It's spending time with others and experiencing the same thing.  I thoroughly enjoyed myself.  
I'm so happy we have this type of place in our town.  They are 100% local, which is great.  As a bonus, they also buy all their materials locally.  What could be better than having fun, creating something unique and very personal, all while supporting the local economy?  Win-win-win!  
Go visit them one of these days.  They have several classes to choose from, and they have two locations, with the other one at Midtown.  We're already planning our next visit.  Hope to run into you there!

My wife and I stopped in for an early dinner during the week and were seated right away.  There is plenty of parking in the shared lot and the interior is brightly lit with colorful decorations and a high ceiling.  Mexican music plays in the background at a level that is heard, but not restrictive of conversation.

We received complementary salsa and chips to start the evening.  I thought they tasted fine, but my wife thought they needed a bit of salt.
Before long, we received our orders:  she got a beef filled chimichanga with a white cheese sauce, rice and beans, and a number of toppings including sour cream, lettuce, pico de gallo, and guacamole.  She thought the flavor was really good.

I ordered the Tacos decarne asada (strips of steak in flour tortillas) with lime wedges, rice and beans.  I was a little surprised that there was no additional toppings, but decided to just try them with the lime juice.  Very Tasty!  Although I enjoy all the other toppings that usually come with midwestern tacos, I have to admit that the bit of lime really brought out the steak flavor!

Our server was friendly though he seemed to be harried trying to keep up with the inflow of new customers.  But in the end, he made an effort to expedite our requests and process our bill since we had a grandchild's concert to attend.

Good food with easy access to the plaza on the northwest corner of US 36 and Dan Jones made it a nice choice for us to grab a quick bite.

Review #3338

Enjoyed a Pink Cadillac Margarita, which had a nice taste to it and was very pretty. Unfortunately a bit on the weak side. 
Chips and salsa were delicious and I ate way too much of them.
My friend had the chili relenos, which looked delicious and was deemed as such by her. 
Personally I savored their arroz con pollo, which was delicioso cheesy goodness ... a mountain of it. Enough for another meal the next day. Well all the chips and salsa probably contributed to that situation also, if I'm being completely honest here. 
Service was courteous and the food came in record time. 
Anyway, check it out.

3 Agaves is the new Mexican restaurant in Avon off Rockville Road behind Arby's. The restaurant is bright with colorful booths and 4 and 6-top tables. The bar is small with ample seating and booths in the bar area.

I stopped in for lunch which is served Mon - Fri, 11:00 - 3:00. My server wasn't much of a conversationalist but was friendly and attentive during my visit.  I was pleasantly surprised at how quickly my drink and lunch was served. Great if you have a limited amount of time for lunch. They also offer a nice variety and sizes of margaritas.

The chips were fresh and warm and the salsa had chunky tomato bits and a touch of heat. I ordered the tender Steak Fajitas with lots of onions, tomatoes and green peppers served with rice, beans, guacamole, sour cream and pico de gallo. The steak was flavorful, not overcooked and tender. The rice and beans were good as well.

The atmosphere was comfortable, the menu offers most of the standard entrees, affordable with quick service. Stop in and give them a try.

I've only been to 3 Agaves once before for a quick lunch and same situation today, I'm popping in for a quick snack and to pick-up dinner for my son.

The restaurant is very festive and has colorful booths with stone trim and baby blue walls in the main dining area..

On this visit I sat in a booth in the bar area which was comfortable. The bar is an average size and can accommodate nine bar patrons. The bartender was professional, friendly and helpful.

I only glanced at the menu since I knew what my son wanted. The menu is several pages and they carry several appetizers, fajitas, burritos, enchildas, quesadillas, tacos and much more.

I ordered the 3 enchiladas topped with enchiladas sauce and sour cream served with rice and refried beans. It looked very good and was served hot and fresh. I also ordered a chicken burrito but it was wrapped to go so I didn't get a chance to see. I'll have to wait for feed-back from my son.

I do like dining at 3 Agaves because the food is good, served hot, food is flavorful and the servers go above and beyond.

Stop in 3 Agaves in Avon Crossing's behind Arby's on Rockville Road.

So I'm still at a 4 stars, but as I'm trying different meals, I find that the panang is not doing it for me.  And I've had the larb gai every time I've been here and the cabbage wedges keep getting smaller and smaller - this last time they were cabbage strips.  I may be wrong but I thought you put a spoonful of the larb on the cabbage wedge and eat it.

I'm going to stick with the red curry and try some other items and find my favorite thing here.  I like the larb gai a lot, but would love it if the cabbage strips turned back into wedges.  :)

And I learned tonite that they will be modifying their menu (taking off most of the American stuff, like burgers and adding more Thai stuff) and best of all, they are looking into adding delivery!  YAY!

Pretty tasty Thai food from a food truck. Food is served pretty quickly, but at the price of watery sauce. Staff is very friendly. 

I tried the red curry with beef. The sauce was essentially soup. But the flavor was good, and they gave a generous amount of beef and bamboo. It came with a good amount of jasmine rice. 

There is a small, basic room next to the truck if you want to "dine in," but you'll still be served with plastic containers and utensils.

Thai hot at this place is no joke!  The food is so delicious! This is the best Panang Curry I've had in Tampa, leaps and bounds better! 

I ordered the Panang Curry with chicken, and it had tons of broccoli, zucchini, and bell peppers, as well as heaping amounts of chicken.  A perfect thick gravy bursting with flavor.  They do it right here! 

The service was very friendly, and the food came out quick.  They have seating outside with plenty of shade, or if you prefer A/C, they offer a small dining area inside.  The price is not bad.  The quantity is plentiful, and the quality is unmatched in this area. 

If you like Thai cuisine, I recommend trying this place out. If you are unsure if you like Thai cuisine or not, I recommend choosing this place to help you decide.

I was not disappointed.  This food is amazing!

I had my aunt take us here because I wanted to try the Crab Fried Rice, and I'm glad I got to try it.  The Crab Fried Rice was very tasty and had good texture.  And there were plenty of crab meat in the rice, which seems way more than the amount other restaurants use in theirs.  It is only $10, which is a very great deal.  I've never seen crab fried rice at any other restaurant for less than $12.95.  My family ordered Pineapple Fried Rice, Spicy Fried Rice, Phad Kee Mao, and a duck bento box.  They weren't too bad, but I don't think as great as my Crab Fried Rice.  Service was excellent.  Our waitress was very friendly and personable.

Was glad to see they were open late on a Friday night - open til 10, we got there about 9:20.  We had the larb gai, the green curry with chicken and the duck fried rice.

Sounds like a very similar menu to what lived in this spot before.

The food was good, the staff was very friendly.

We sat outside at a picnic table in front of the truck next to a small water fountain/feature that helped with the Dale Mabry road traffic noise.

I need another visit and try another dish to make another assessment.  But so far, it's a quick, good Thai fix.

Excellent food, they are located in the old Kombo Kitchen truck in the same place on Dale Mabry. I had the pad thai, fried rice and chicken panang, all excellent (see photo).

Really nice people also.

I FINALLY got to try Thai 5 after it sat in my bookmarks for far too long. We ordered through Postmates because yes, we are that lazy even though it is right down the street. After reading all the Yelp reviews, we went with the Crab Rangoons, Banana Coins, Drunken Noodles (medium), and Duck Fried Rice (medium). All were amazing!!

The Crab Rangoons were delicious and the Sweet Chili Sauce that came with it was surprisingly really good. The Drunken Noodles were very spicy even after asking for it medium, but so full of flavor with lots of fresh vegetables. The Duck Fried rice was topped with crispy fried duck that melted in your mouth. To end the meal, the Banana Coins were the perfect compliment to the spicy Thai food. They're basically fried bananas with honey but they were amazing, I've never had anything like them before. 

Portion sizes were huge, the two of us definitely could have split one entree. Prices were very reasonable as well. If they offered their own delivery service, this would be my go-to. I'll be back to try the Crab Fried Rice and the Pad Thai!

Thai 5 is awesome. We had visited the Kombo Kitchen truck back in the day and had only been back once since it turned into Thai 5. We definitely won't be staying away in the future - it's definitely the best Thai we have found in South Tampa, and some of the best in the Tampa Bay area! My favorite is definitely the Thai sausage. We got the drunken noodles last night and they were good, but not as good as the other dishes we have had from there (my old favorites were crab fried rice and padwoonsen). Their fresh rolls are delicious, especially the peanut sauce which tastes homemade. I know others have complained about pick-up times, but we were quoted 25-30 minutes and I'm pretty sure it was done quicker than that (it was ready when we arrived to pick it up). Love me some Thai 5!

my favorite thai places in Tampa!! It use to be a truck however expanded into a restaurant. Still as a restaurant they provide a home-y feel and welcome you with open arms! Everything on the menu has been full of flavor and they definitely do not skimp on the portions! I highly recommend any of the entrees but my favorites include the steam
Potstickers, eggplant basil stir fry, pad won sen. Everything is amazing!! So glad this is a short 10 min drive form me

Looking at this place from the outside you wouldn't think much of it, but I'm sure glad I decided to give it a try. Their potstickers come in a pork or chicken and steamed or pan fried option. They're flavorful and a plentiful appetizer option. I decided to also try the spicy drunken noodles with chicken and it was also a massive portion for the price. The quality of the food was excellent and I think I found my new quick, go to place for my future Thai cravings.

Very take-out style place. You can dine-in, but everything will still be served in styrofoam, which I found a little wasteful.

Tried the pad Thai and panang curry. Both incredibly flavorful. The pad Thai was SUCH a huge portion and was very saucy with plenty of crushed peanuts. It was also decently spicy so keep that in mind.

Overall, for the price, I think you are getting some great Thai food. It's not the best I've ever had by any means, but I think it's a great option.

5 stars! I'm feeling generous tonight...I ordered the panang curry with chicken ($10) to go. The flavors were great and the portion size was adequate. My only complaint is that the sauce wasn't thick. Panang sauce should have a thickness derived from using crushed peanuts as the thickening agent. A Thai friend of mine who works at a Thai restaurant said it probably wasn't thickened in order to satisfy American tastes. I don't know  if this is the reason why Thai 5 makes it like this or if it's just a time saver but I had great panang curry with a thicker sauce at another Thai restaurant and I loved it. Instead this panang was very drippy and splashy but again, the taste was awesome and that's what's most important. Note: it comes with broccoli so if you're anti-broccoli like me, make sure you tell them.

The service was friendly and I appreciate that the lady wrapped up the bowl in saran wrap to prevent leakage on my ride home. I'll have to visit again and eat there. Nice to see that they have indoor and outdoor seating even though they serve out of the food truck.

We had Shrimp Tom Yum soup. Very delicious. One of the best Tom Yum I ever had. Found 2 medium shrimps in there. I was going to have short rib dish but they ran out. I ordered Hot and spicy duck noodle bowl instead. I had Vietnamese duck noodle soup, Cantonese duck noodle soup before  and this  Hot and spicy duck noodle bowl  surprised me. It was so good. The duck meat  was tender, the broth was flavorful and pleasing the mouth , not the annoying hot and spicy type. The egg noodle was cooked right, not too hard, not too soft. A couple pieces of Chinese broccoli, whole bunch of cilantro , the wonderful combination was so impressive. The crab meat fried rice got couple chuck of crab meat and the fried rice was very tasty. The portion was big. We had leftover to take home. The chef really has good skills. Although we ate the food out of the box and using plastic spoon, the dining room got AC . So it wasn't too bad.

Thai 5 is certainly match the top 100 of Yelp list that just recent published. Their kitchen is still in the food truck. I have seen the previous food truck move out this location and become a restaurant. I believe one day they will too. 

We have order the Tom Yum Soup. I would say this is the best I have taste. For this restaurant medium hot is too hot for many people. For me is just right. This restaurant definition of hotness is bring the heat. So be careful what you asking for. You may have difficult time to kiss your date after burning lip and past the caliente heat kiss to you love one. 

We have order the crab fried rice and duck noodle soup. I have order the Thai hot and it came with it. I like it very much for this fried rice since it is different than other cuisine fried rice. The dish do have chunk of crab meat. The duck noodle is street type vendor flavor cooking. The duck is deboned and easy to enjoy. The curry base soup is yummy to eat. 

I give them 4 stars is they pricing is in the high side for food truck (value vs. restaurant setting) and they run out of material for certain dish. The food is 5 stars.

So happy to see a Thai food truck back in the same spot where Kombo Kitchen once existed.

When I asked if there was still a connection, I was told it was the same chef as KK. That was very encouraging.

The woman who greeted me and took my order was sweet and accomodating as I could not decide between two dishes. So she offered to combine the two and put them together for me at one price.

My order was prepared quickly, shown to me before being packaged up to take home for dinner and I was offered water while I eagerly waited near my car.

There was plenty of food for the price, so they clearly are generous with the portions.

Unfortunately, I was disappointed in the overall dish and would not have that same combination again. 

Maybe I put two items together that just did not work, but one of the items was simply not prepared as I expected and was actually not worth ordering at all.

Thai 5 is still worth trying again. I'll just be a little less creative next time and ask more questions.

My Thai side always gravitates toward Pad Thai, Drunken Noodles, Tom Yum, Mango Sticky Rice, etc. - I can eat it for breakfast, lunch and dinner!

I went with a To Go order of Beef Pad Thai ($9.95+tax) - medium spicy because it is better that way and they didn't disappoint and delivered on that (I received a small container full of chili flakes, so I could customize on the amount of heat. Of course, I added all of it!). They have one size for their pad thai - it can definitely be split between two people! As you can tell in the pic., my friend sneaked a couple delish bites & I still had plenty left. As a personal preference, I didn't like the raw bean sprouts; I'm glad they put the peanuts on the side because I only like it in small quantities and as strange as it sounds, this foodie is neither a big fan of bean sprouts or peanuts. 

They are located next to Pinch A Penny, so that's a tell tale to turn into their parking lot because it's not easy to see from the road.

The best Thai restaurant in Tampa bar none. They used to operate solely out of a truck but now they have a brick and mortar restaurant. My husband and I order Thai 5 on a weekly basis because once you've had it, your cravings won't stop. I alternate between the Chicken Panang Curry, the Drunken Noodles, and the Chicken Pad Thai. My husband loves the Pad Se Ew, and we always order the steamed pork potstickers as an appetizer. The food is clearly fresh, authentic, and extremely flavorful. Be careful if you ask for Thai Spice it will be hot even in medium form. Prices are reasonable but you will have to wait 20 to 30 minutes for preparation.  It is worth the wait.

Crab fried rice - this was good even the next day! I appreciate that they use fresh crab and not krab stick. A good portion of crab too. I think I could do without the pepper. Everything mixed well and no flavor was overpowering or more of one item than another.
Crab Rangoon - best I ever had? No. But for the price - a pretty solid choice? Yes! It is what you expect in any classic crab Rangoon - the perk is that it isn't all cream cheese filling or all dough - a pretty decent balance. A tad smaller than I like, but good.
Thai Iced Tea - $5 for a large - it was surprisingly good. It wasn't the typical milky orange looking drink - it was actually darker so I was skeptical... and yes, pleasantly surprised after the first few sips.
It's a tiny restaurant off Dale Mabry, but enough tables inside and outside it seemed. I took my order to go - friendly and fast service.

We have finally found a place where we can enjoy Thai food in the area!  On past trips, we have had TERRIBLE thai food and were just about ready to give up on ever going to a Thai restaurant in the Orlando/Tampa area.  After reading the reviews, we decided to try it out.  Favorite dishes were definitely the crab rangoon, seafood lard na and pumpkin panang curry.  Service here is excellent!  They are very friendly and welcoming/

I'm updating my review because I had a good experience recently!

***As always, the Beef Pad Thai didn't let me down at all! It's still a generous serving with plenty of beef as well as noodles. I forgot to add a side of chili flakes because that def. would've amped up the heat - Thai 5 definitely serves one of the bestest Pad Thai in Tampa! 

I tried their Mango Sticky Rice because I haven't been able to fulfill my cravings since the Thai Temple Sun. Market is still closed due to Covid-19...Thai 5's version was a letdown - it lacked the usual sweet coconut milk in the sticky rice...not very much was mixed in it. (:-/)

Another must order is Thai Tea! Theirs is SWEET - I think I am more used to the version that includes more condensed milk or any type of creamer...I still think it hits the spot and a reorder for me especially since it's only $3!!

To cap it off, I had to order their Chicken Tom Yum Soup. This was so delicioso! Not only was it an epic serving of mushrooms, onions and tomatoes as well as chicken - the flavors are all there which includes sour, sweet and savory!***

Right now, they still aren't allowing dining in for safety reasons! You must call your order in for pick-up only. They have updated hours on Yelp now and still next to Pinch A Penny - that's your signal to turn into their small parking lot for yummy Thai food!

As I've been exclusively saving my weekend meals for Thai food (curry, in particular), I had to try out Thai 5 when I was in the area. I followed Mark P.'s lead and ordered the Panang curry. It is undoubtedly delicious! The flavor is definitely there, but it is well-balanced with coconut milk. I don't even care for coconut milk, but I love the smoothness it gives to the curry. While, I do agree that it needs more thickness, this is probably the second best Panang curry I've had in Tampa thus far (Singha Thai has been my current favorite). The family who owns and runs this establishment is incredibly friendly and seeing from their interactions with other customers, they are a neighborhood favorite.

Was really craving Pad Thai and found this spot on Yelp so decided to give it a try.  It was about 45mins prior to their closing so we placed the order online and headed right over to pick it up.

The restaurant is off the side of a main road, and is very easy to drive right by if you're not paying attention -- so be attentive and slow down early.

There are about three parking spots in front and a few more to the left of the building.  Due to COVID they are only doing take out and delivery, with the option of eating your food on one of their outside bench tables, with an umbrella to help block the sun.

I ordered a tofu and shrimp pad thai which came out to be about $14.  The portion size here is definitely for a family as the pad thai lasted me for 4 meals!  The Thai Hot was spicy and had good flavor but I feel it completely took away from the other flavors pad thai should have; e.g. tamarind.  Nonetheless the pad thai was great here and I would definitely order it again.

The following day, because the pad thai was so good, I wanted to try something else on their menu.  So I ordered the drunken noodles with chicken in medium this time.  Same deal here with the portion size, although this one lasted me only 3 meals -- thinking it was the extra protein that allows for an extra meal.  The flavor was great, but the heat for medium was not hot enough, so thinking next time I'll try their hot (in between medium and Thai hot).

If you're in the area and craving Thai food, so far, this is the place to beat.

First- this is not a fancy place (inside or outside). But the food makes up for the lack anywhere else! :) Great Thai food options, curries and sauces! Friendly service and good prices. Definitely worth checking out!

*accessible entrance*

I ordered take-out from Thai 5 after reading many stellar reviews and was quite pleased with my decision! The Crab Rangoon - which is served with Thai sweet chili sauce - was a very tasty starter; I wished the wonton ends were less crispy/hard, but I happily ate the center stuffing and it was delicious! 

After learning from Yelp that the Crab fried rice and Pumpkin Panang Curry were popular entree choices, I decided that I wanted to try both. So I asked the gentleman over the phone if I could order the Pumpkin Panang with chicken and jasmine rice - as well as a side of the crab fried rice (since I really just wanted to try it). Since the menu did not reflect the ability to add side orders, he kindly indicated that he could input a "half portion" - which was fine by me. The half portion ended up being HUGE (basically seemed like a full entree serving...just see the picture I uploaded if you're in doubt). 

I appreciated Thai 5's flexibility by graciously accommodating my request.  This showed me that their customer service efforts are truly exceptional. He asked if I wanted the regular fried rice or the spicy fried rice. I didn't recall reading about the spicy fried rice on Yelp or on the menu, so I asked for his opinion. He said that the spicy kind is more popular and that it would be good with the crab. As it turns out, I absolutely HATED the spicy fried rice with crab. I took two bites and ended up tossing the whole thing. Rather than discrediting the restaurant for this, I attributed this experience to my personal taste. It was way too peppery and the spices really took away from the taste of egg and other ingredients (an appeal that fried rice traditionally offers). I also wondered if I was more adverse to the seafood aspect of this dish - this was a dish that I just wanted to try, and now I know, the crab spicy fried rice is not for me. 

The Pumpkin Panang with chicken, on the other hand was DELICIOUS! I love that this entree is available year round (since many restaurants only offer Pumpkin flavored entrees during the fall season). This was the first Thai restaurant I have ordered from in Tampa that has offered the Pumpkin Panang flavor. The dish could have been slightly sweeter and the potatoes were too soft to stick my fork into, but the consistency of the sauce and the generous serving of chicken was just enough to satiate my appetite!  

I'll definitely be back with the hopes of trying their coconut rice and more of what Thai 5 has to offer!

Drove by this spot way too many times before finally dropping by. The location has served up many types of food over the years but none of the former restaurants seemed to stick around for long.

Here's hoping that Thai 5 Fast Food is here for the long run!

Judging from the booming take out business on a recent weeknight visit there is definitely a following and now I know why.

The interior is pleasant but casual. Go to the counter to place your order. Fill up a cup of water from the tabletop in the back or find what you want to drink in the chilled section across from the counter.

Seat yourself in a comfy booth or table. Plastic utensils, napkins and all sorts of sauces are already conveniently provided at the table.

Then wait for goodness to arrive.

The dishes tried were delivered in containers that also double as take out  boxes for the food you can't consumer all in one sitting.

So for portions, prices and just tasty Thai food, this is the place to go. The menu is packed with salads, noodle dishes, soups and more that likely leave you very satisfied and maybe a bit sniffly, depending on the amount of heat you select or add to your food.

Five stars for Thai 5! You are welcome.

I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place! Everything I've had here is SO good! My favorites are the red chicken curry and the drunken noodles. My wife and I also really like the soups. The portions are awesome and every last bite is full of deliciousness! I've called in and ordered in person, and the lady is always so sweet. More importantly, they've never screwed up my order. Ordering in person, the wait isn't bad either. The food is great, you get lots of it, and I will continue coming here for my Thai food cravings.

Still one of my favorite places, I pop in once a month to use my wine club credits. I use the fishers the location, it's close to my house and I love the set up and just relaxing inside.
Right now, they have stopped tastings, but it is still enjoyable to go in a glass or a flight.
For those who don't know, this is an Indiana family that makes wine from California, and it's tasty stuff. 
The variety has something for everyone, and they can always answer questions you might have about what you are drinking.
Ensure you check out the charity wall since the workers don't get tips; when you tip, it goes towards a local charity, which I think is an excellent feature that you don't see in many places. 
They have a Carmel and mass ave location. Make sure you check them out!

Such a cute spot! We've been to the Carmel and Mass Ave locations, and saw Yelp Elite Lee S serving wine here a few months back, so it had to be great right?! 

This weekend, they had awesome live musicians playing and opened up the space completely to the outside. They had arrows pointing where to order and Edit so that the traffic flowed one way. The woman behind the bar was sooooo nice and shared all of the options with us. I love that you can do a $5 wine tasting - such an approachable price! I also love that they have wine flights in addition to glasses or bottles. We didn't have much time before dinner, so we shared the red wine flight. The Grateful Red was our favorite! 

The interior is super colorful, funky, and boho. It's so fun and beautiful. There was a big curtain in front of the back room, so I'm guessing that you could rent out that room for a bridal party, baby shower, etc. 

This place is owned by a local family with many children. They let each of their kids pick a non-profit of their choice for all of the winery tips to support. There are buckets on the wall that list each of the non-profits. So cool! The wine is from California too, so it's more bitter than sweet which we love. We'll be back!

When I saw this location in the yard, I got so excited! It took some convincing of my friends but thankfully they decided to come with me to test out some wine.
The location is their third in the Indianapolis area, there is one in Carmel one in mass ave, and now one in the yard.
This location is just as cute as their other locations, they have a tasting bar and you can select up to 5 different wines, Peace water also rotates on a regular basis which is nice if you enjoy a variety.
One of the things I enjoy about peace water is that they are an Indiana family, all of their wine comes from California so the flavor is always unique, traditional and delicious.
They also really focus on safety, which in these times is important, you have to wear a mask until you are up at the bar or sitting at one of the places to enjoy a glass or split a bottle.
Check this location out! It does not disappoint
It's your basic urban Walgreens in New Orleans, this particular Walgreens was new after Katrina, so its in good shape. Clean and well organized.

This is your basic Walgreens. It is clean and well organized. The restrooms are always well stocked and clean. This location does have a baby changing table in the women's restroom, which is awesome! Extra clerks are always available when the lines get long, and after dark, there is always an off duty police officer standing in the front of the store. In the evenings, there is a uniformed police officer standing in the front, near the entrance, which is good, because I have seen people getting angry with each other. Mainly customers. The employees may seem a bit unhappy but have never misbehaved from what I have seen.


Are there occasionally bums outside panhandling? Yes.

Are there guys outside selling CD's of their music occasionally? Yes.

All in all, this is a decent Walgreens in a decent location.

What does a one $ sign, fabulous food in a pleasant setting  and great service warrant?     A 5 Star review!!!

That's cute, authentic and amazing Mexican BYOB did the trick for us in filling our bellies on this beautiful summer evening. All 3 of us Ordered the Carnitas which were shredded pork with a side of cactus, beans and rice and guac and chips. Everything was fresh and homemade and you could taste the love. I felt like my mama had made me a great big wonderful dinner. 
And we got to try cactus! The only other time the three of us that had cactus was when we had cactus martinis in the Grand Canyon. The free chips and salsa were refilled  each time our server saw them go low. 
3 ate heartily for $46 including 2 sodas. 
Great experience in this wonderful South Philly Mexican restaurant. We are going back soon

While visiting a friend, she ordered takeout from here, and it was amazing! My friend didn't realize the restaurant name and menu had changed at first; I believe they used to be called 'Maribel'. I ordered the chicken enchiladas with salsa verde. The chicken was so tender, and the sauce was so flavorful. The beans and rice on the side were delicious as well. By the time I was finished, my carton was pretty much empty. I didn't try them but my friend and her family raved about the chips and guacamole. The restaurant itself is located on the corner of Moore Street. There are a few tables in there for a sit-down meal. Oh, and they're cash only! I'll definitely be back to try something else on the menu.

My friend and I came here before heading to Bok Bar and had a delicious, filling meal! We split an order of chips and guacamole. The guacamole was sooooo fresh, with tons of lime in it. I ordered the Mushroom Quesadillas, which were really delicious. I do wish they had come with a salsa or something else acidic to cut through the richness from the mushrooms and cheese. My friend got the chicken enchiladas which he really enjoyed, and I was jealous that his dish came with rice and refried beans! I definitely recommend stopping by for a bite to eat before/after hitting up Bok Bar!

Welcoming service, amazing burritos, cute and bright interior for a hole-in-the-wall. 

PROS: There is no breakfast burrito on menu, but they do have breakfast and burritos, so at 1pm the lovely woman taking my order talked to the chef who agreed to make me one with basically anything I wanted. It's unclear whether they do breakfast all day, or decided "why not?!" since the place was entirely empty. We settled on egg, chorizo, beans, tomato, onion, cheese, and sour cream ($10). Far from the ones reminiscent of LA that I'm seeking, but I love the flexibility and willingness! This thing was big, full of eggs and chorizo, super fresh, and had amazing flavor! The al pastor burrito (con todos, $10) and the salsa verde are both knockouts as well!

CONS: Eventually, I ate it all :(

There's a reason this place has 5 stars; come experience it!

Don't let the outside of this place scare you away. The inside is cozy and clean just as other Yelpers have described. It's hard to find good Mexican food in Philly, but I was pleasantly surprised at this place. 

The focus is on Mexico City style food. The menu is quite limited, but we were really happy with what we got. As others have mentioned, the star of the show are the quesadillas. It's not like what you think of when you think of a quesadilla. I would never normally go out and order that because it's something you can make easily in five minutes. However, this one was different. It is a fried crispy dough with filling in the far inside (we got cheese and mushroom) and topped with queso fresco and lettuce. It's all about the texture of the dough and it's not something I could easily make at home. The portion is also incredibly generous. You get two per order. They're probably terrible for you since they seem to be fried, but hey we all got to live a little. 

The chicken tostadas were also tasty. The chicken was tender and well marinaded. The enchiladas were just okay, so I will order something else next time instead of them. Free fresh chips and salsa were brought to the table. They kindly offered to refill our salsa later so we could enjoy it with our dishes. It was nice and smokey with a little heat to it. 

Service is friendly. I love the open kitchen. To enjoy your meal in comfort, I wouldn't go on a day with a strong temperature extreme. We went on a cold evening and it was really chilly inside. It appears they only have one little old heating/air unit.

Maribel has changed their name, but the delicious flavor and friendly service have stayed the same. I find myself returning here often for their Mexico City style quesadillas. If you have never had this, or even if you have, it's a must order! It's a homemade crispy masa dough that is fried and stuffed with Oaxaca cheese, a protein of your choice or mushrooms, lettuce, cream, and a little queso fresco on top. Then I add some of their homemade green and red salsa for a little heat. The ingredients come together in perfect harmony, but the crispy texture of the shell is what really makes it. 

When I first started ordering them, I got mushrooms because I would share a chicken dish with my husband too, so I wanted to change things up. Recently, I've been going because of my quesadilla craving and ordering them on my own. The first time I did this, I ordered chicken. It was pretty tasty grilled chicken, but I preferred the mushrooms. The second time I ordered it as tinga de pollo and ended up with the delicious well seasoned shredded chicken that is in their tostadas that I love so much. So please make sure you specify which one you're after when you order! 

I also found out that they can make this dish grilled as well. I am always tempted to try it, but the super crispy fried corn dough is always calling my name. If someone gets around to trying it, please let me know. I am just too addicted to the original at the moment!

I came here to kill some time for Mi Pueblito food truck outside. Super friendly staff, but most likely owners . I ordered chips and guacamole and my guacamole was made fresh in front of me so I can customize by asking not to put jalapeño. 

I will definitely come back to try their food

I came back here because I enjoyed the fresh guacamole. I saw a sign promoting the birria tacos. Keep in mind that this restaurant is not related to Mi Pueblito truck that makes awesome birria tacos.

I was greeted by super friendly lady, very welcoming. 

Birria tacos: the broth was salty, not too much flavor. I would rather wait an hour outside for the truck.

Al pastor: small pieces of pork, missing the pineapple pieces, not too much flavor. It's a little bit salty for my taste.

In my continued quest for the perfect Al Pastor taco my search today led me to Mexico Lindo. I first have to say that I lucked up and got a parking spot right in front of the place because trust me parking around this area is tight and there are tow signs literally every where so know before you go.

The restaurant is very small. You can eat in but there are only five or six tables. The gentleman who took my order was very nice.

On to the tacos. I was hoping for greatness but I just got okay. Like with Chiquita's Pizzeria and Mexican Grill, Mexico Lindo also puts sauteed onions in with the pork. I simply don't understand why you need cooked onions when you are going to garnish it with raw onions. Maybe it's a Mexican South Philly thing. In any event I took them out. There was plenty of pineapple included which I loved. There was no grilled jalapeno or radish on the side and the limes had definitely seen better days. The salsas were thin and watery but the green one had good flavor. The taste of the Pastor was acceptable but clearly my search must go on. Other than that, I would try other menu items.

Great place to come to kill some time.  They have a driving range, a mini golf course and a pitch and putt course. 

The driving range has some heated and covered stalls so you can come all year round.  They have clubs you can borrow or you can bring your own.  A large bucket of balls is only $12 and there's usually always a coupon you can get from the mail!

Came here to shake off some of that winter stiffness and hit some balls at their driving range--two problems:

1. It was chilly
2. It was supposed to rain that day

After looking around online and realizing that there didn't seem to be too many great options, I was close to giving up until...
Solution--they have heated stalls with overhead covering. SOLD.

Next issue was I had actually forgot my clubs at home(real slick, I know).

LUCKILY the Golf Galaxy nearby was having a free demo so I actually got to try the new line of clubs out on the market. 

The range itself seems to be fairly standard, but the heated/covered stalls to protect you from the elements was DEFINITELY a good call.


Next time I'm in the area, I DEFINTELY plan on coming here to practive my shots.

This meal was positively lovely.

We arrived on a Friday evening a bit early for our reservation.  The table wasn't ready yet so we sat outside on their small bench and the server who greeted us brought us some water.

Finally at our seat we perused the menu and settled on the heirloom tomato salad (feta on the side) and the bloody beet steak (yogurt on the side)  Both dishes were as excellent to taste as they were to look at. If there is something they know here, it's wow factor with food.  They have great presentation.  The beets were perfectly cooked and I love the play on meat even though it didn't contain any.  Each dish stood on its own and was rich but not overpowering.

For my entree, I went with the short ribs.  I expected tender short ribs but I was blown away by the sauce and the sides.  This dish was a symphony of flavor and even though I don't eat much meat these days, this dish was easily up there with some of the best I've had.

Service was excellent and they kept both our water and our beer glasses full (we split a bottle of Pumking)  This restaurant was an excellent way to begin my labor day weekend and my plan now is to come back for the squid ink pasta.

F & F, you've got a new fan.

Part 1 of 2

OK, let's get this out of the way: I HATE THE NAME OF THIS RESTAURANT.

Ignoring the awkward grammar, explicitly alluding to "farm to table", "farm to fork",  "snout to tail", "slow food" or whatever in the name of your restaurant is the equivalent of someone painting a giant quote from Alice Waters on the wall of their restaurant.  Gag me with the figurative spoon, please!

That said, I LOVE EVERYTHING ELSE ABOUT THIS RESTAURANT!!!

Josh Lawler (ex-Chef de Cuisine at the famous farm-restaurant Blue Hill at Stone Barns in NY) and his lovely wife Colleen have created another one of what Philly does so much better than any other city in the world: an intimate, casual-yet-classy, food-centric BYOB that will undoubtedly be joining the likes of Blackfish, Bibou, Fond and Matyson on everyone's top 10 lists.  In fact, Chip Roman himself highly recommended this restaurant to us (and having been Josh's roommate at Drexel Culinary, Chip also doesn't pass up a chance to give props in the press to his new competition), so it was only a matter of time before our wine group made a pilgrimage here.  Undoubtedly the first of many...

FF is an intimate, ~30 seat BYOB on Pine Street, with fairly easy parking at a couple of lots within a few minute walk.
